dialog: Hast thou shed any pounds, my friend?
Aye, I have indeed dropped a fair number of stones since last moon.
When was the last time thou visited the healer?
It was two moons past.
Allow me to take thy blood pressure. Thou dost appear pale.
Fear not, Mr. Brown, 'tis nothing of great concern.
Thou art simply a bit worn out from over exertion.
What am I to do, healer?
A holiday would do thee wonders, I believe.
Try to spend more time in the open air and ensure thou get enough rest.
Thank thee, healer. I shall follow thy advice.
Good morrow, Angela. How hast thou been of late?
Mornin', Michael. I have been most busy as of late. One of our suppliers is closing shop, and I have been searching for a worthy replacement.
Fear not, Angela. Thou canst always count on us to be here for the long haul. Care for a seat and a cuppa?
Nay, thank thee. I have been trying to cut down on the caffeine.
Ha, I could never do that. I would be a zombie without my morning coffee. Let us then get down to business.
Aye. I have come to discuss the ordering of eight megapixel cameras for our new methone. The demand for such devices is growing, and Pear has fallen behind in the market.
Marvelous news! I am glad Pear has finally joined the fray. Currently, our agreement is for five megapixel cameras. Is Pear still interested in obtaining such devices?
Nay, we have changed all cameras to eight megapixels. We had hoped that by making thy company our sole supplier for cameras, we could negotiate a better agreement.
Indeed. Let us then draft a new agreement.
